questions.text: Which of the following drugs is not indicated to treat female infertility?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Raloxifene Raloxifene is not indicated to treat female infertility.

Highyeild:

Raloxifene- Raloxifene is a Selective estrogen receptor modulator (SERM) Indications- A second-line drug for prevention and treatment of osteoporosis in postmenopausal women, Ca2+ and vit D supplements enhance the benefit. According to British guidelines, raloxifene is not recommended for primary prophylaxis of osteoporotic fractures in postmenopausal women but is an alternative option for secondary prevention and treatment of vertebral fractures , i.e. in those who have already suffered a fracture. It is also approved for the prevention of breast cancer in women with risk factors.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option: A. Clomiphene - Clomiphene citrate is used in the treatment of infertility , it acts by blocking negative feedback by estrogen and induces ovulation. Option: B. Leuprolide and C. Goserelin - are pulsatile GnRH agonists which can be used in the treatment of infertility.

Extraedge:

Clomiphene - An estrogen receptor antagonist in most target tissues. Blockade of estrogen receptors in the hypothalamus counteracts the estrogen-induced negative feedback on the hypothalamic-pituitary-ovarian axis. This effect often allows normal pulsatility of gonadotropin-releasing hormone (GnRH) release from the hypothalamus to occur, stimulating a normal pattern of follicle-stimulating hormone(FSH) and luteinizing hormone (LH) release from the anterior pituitary , resulting in ovulation. The drug has been used for more than 25 years to treat infertility when other causes have been ruled out. However, clomiphene may exhibit negative effects, including an increased incidence of multiple births, ovarian cysts, and ovarian hyperstimulation syndrome.

questions.text: Dose of ulipristal for emergency contraception?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

30mg The dose of ulipristal for emergency contraception is 30mg.

Highyeild:

Ulipristal- A recently approved ‘selective progesterone receptor modulator’ (SPRM) for use as an emergency contraceptive. Mechanism of action - Inhibits ovulation Suppresses LH surge Suppresses follicular rupture Action on endometrium can interfere with In clinical trials, the efficacy of ulipristal (30 mg) as an emergency contraceptive has been rated equal to that of levonorgestrel (1.5 mg) when taken within 72 hours of unprotected intercourse, and to be more effective when taken between 72–120 hours. Thus, it may have an advantage , if the woman misses taking the drug within 72 hours. Side effects Headache, nausea, vomiting, abdominal pain and menstrual delay ovarian cysts anti glucocorticoid

questions.text: Breakthrough bleeding is the most common problem with:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Progesterone-only pill Breakthrough bleeding is the most common problem with Progesterone-only Episodes of irregular, unpredictable spotting and breakthrough bleeding are the most frequently encountered untoward effect and the major reason women discontinue the use of progesterone-only contraceptives.

Highyeild:

Adverse effects of Oral Contraceptive Pills- Non Serious side effects- Nausea and vomiting Headache Mild Precipitate migraine Breakthrough bleeding /spotting especially with progestin- only preparations. Shifting to a triphasic pill may overcome the breakthrough bleeding. Rarely bleeding fails to occur during the gap period. Prolonged amenorrhoea or cycle disruption occurs in a few women taking injectables or mini pills. Especially with Progestin-only pills Breast discomfort Late side effects- Weight gain, acne, increased body hair Chloasma Pruritus vulvae Carbohydrate intolerance precipitation diabetes Mood swings Mental depression Abdominal distension Serious complications - Leg vein thrombosis and pulmonary embolism Coronary and cerebral thrombosis Myocardial infarction Stroke The estrogen component is responsible Increase in blood clotting factor decreased antithrombin3 decreased plasminogen activator in the endothelium increased platelet aggregation Rise in BP Genital carcinoma Increased vaginal, breast, and cervical cancer Benign hepatomas Gallstones

Extraedge:

Centchroman (Ospemifene) - Nonsteroidal SERM(Selective Estrogen Receptor Modulator) an oral contraceptive. It has predominant estrogen antagonistic action in the uterus and breast with little action on the vaginal epithelium and cervical mucus. Endometrial proliferation is suppressed by the down-regulation of endometrial ER. Excessive bleeding attending anovulatory cycles is diminished & it is also approved for use in dysfunctional uterine bleeding. Contraceptive action is probably due to uterus-embryonic asynchrony and failure of implantation. For contraception- 30 mg twice a week for 12 weeks followed by once a week. Chhaya (8-centchroman tablet ) is provided free by the government of India.

options.label: A
options.text: Take two tablets the next day and continue the remaining pill as usual.

options.label: B
options.text: Take the missed pill as soon as possible and continue the remaining pill as usual, consider EC if UPSI has taken place.

options.text: Manage as a new start contraception

options.text: Take the missed pill as soon as possible and continue the remaining pill as usual, EC is not required even if UPSI has taken place.

questions.correct_answer: B. Take the missed pill as soon as possible and continue the remaining pill as usual, consider EC if UPSI has taken place.
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Take the missed pill as soon as possible and continue the remaining pill as usual, consider EC if UPSI has taken place. As the patient has missed 3 pills in week 1 she should Take the missed pill as soon as possible and continue the remaining pill as usual , consider EC if UPSI has taken place(As week 1 is the most important phase to suppress ovulation ).

Highyeild:

FSRH CEU Guidance: Recommended Actions after Incorrect Use of Combined Hormonal Contraception (March 2020, Amended 6 July 2021) 21 DAYS PILL AND 7 DAYS HFI The first 7 days-pill suppress ovulation Next 14 days-pill maintain anovulation Guidance on actions after incorrect use of Combined Oral contraception Monophasic Combined Oral Contraceptives without placebo pills ● Late restarting after HFI ≥ 9 completed days since the last pill was taken Consider EC , if UPSI has taken place during/after HFI, ➢ take the most recent missed pill as soon as possible. ➢ continue the remaining pills at the usual time. ➢ Condoms should be used or sex avoided until pills have been taken for 7 consecutive days. ● 1 missed pill in week 1 after HFI EC not required* ➢ take the missed pill as soon as possible. ➢ continue the remaining pills at the usual time. ➢ No additional contraceptive precaution is needed. in week 2 or week 3 after HFI EC not required** ● 2-7 pills missed in week 1 after HFI Consider EC if UPSI has taken place during the HFI or week 1 ➢ take the most recent missed pill as soon as possible. ➢ continue the remaining pills at the usual time. ➢ Condoms should be used or sex avoided until pills have been taken for 7 consecutive days. ➢ Consider a follow-up pregnancy test. in week 2 or week 3 after HFI EC not required** ➢ take the most recent missed pill as soon as possible. ➢ continue the remaining pills at the usual time. ➢ Condoms should be used or sex avoided until pills have been taken for 7 consecutive days. ➢ If missed 7 days before HFI, omit the HFI. ● >7 consecutive pills missed ANY week Consider EC ➢ Manage as a new start contraception ➢ consider an immediate pregnancy test ➢ quick start new COC packet ➢ Condoms should be used or sex avoided until pills have been taken for 7 consecutive days. ➢ Consider a follow-up pregnancy test. HFI-Hormone Free Interval UPSI-UnProtected Sexual Intercourse EC-Emergency contraceptive COC-Combined Oral contraception * if consistent, correct use earlier in week 1 and the 7 days before the HFI **If consistent, correct use in previous 7 days

questions.text: A Woman on combined OCPs was taking it irregularly in a cycle. She became pregnant and what advice did you give to her:

Termination of pregnancy If pregnancy occurs during the use of hormonal contraceptives it should be terminated by suction-aspiration because the risk of malformations , genital carcinoma in female offspring, and undescended testes in male offspring is increased.

questions.text: Prolonged testosterone treatment for a man results in:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Azoospermia Continuous and prolonged use of GnRH agonists and gonadal hormones ( testosterone, estrogen) leads to suppression of gonadal function due to inhibition of LH and FSH resulting in decreased sperm production(Azoospermia) and testicular size. Since this effect is usually reversible , it is investigated as a therapeutic approach for male contraception.

Highyeild:

Androgen side effects- Administered to women , androgens can cause virilization , excess body hair, and menstrual irregularities. Many effects, e.g. voice change may be permanent after prolonged therapy. Acne: in both males and females Frequent, sustained, and often painful erections in males at the beginning of therapy; subside spontaneously after sometime Oligozoospermia can occur with moderate doses given for a few weeks to men with normal testosterone levels . Prolonged use may produce testicular atrophy. Precocious puberty, premature sexual behavior, and stunting of stature due to early closure of epiphysis if testosterone is given continuously to young boys for increasing stature. Salt retention and edema: especially when large doses are given to patients with heart or kidney disease. This is rare with the doses used for hypogonadism. Hepatic carcinoma: incidence is higher in patients who have received long-term methyltestosterone or other oral androgens. Gynaecomastia : In children and in patients with liver disease. This is due to the peripheral conversion of testosterone to estrogens. Dihydrotestosterone does not cause gynecomastia because it is not converted to estradiol. 17-alpha-alkyl Lowering of HDL and rise in LDL prone to stroke Cholestatic jaundice reversible on discontinuation.

Random:

Increased HDL level- prolonged use of testosterone causes a Lowering of HDL and a rise in LDL levels. Option: D. Increased gonadotropins -prolonged use of testosterone causes a fall in gonadotropins level due to negative feedback.

questions.text: Failure of oral contraceptives occurs when used with any of these except:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Aspirin Aspirin doesn’t cause Oral contraceptive failure .

Highyeild:

Oral contraceptive failure may occur if the following drugs are used concurrently: A) Enzyme inducers: phenytoin, phenobarbitone, primidone, carbamazepine, rifampin, ritonavir. Metabolism of estrogenic as well as progestational components is increased. B) Suppression of intestinal microflora: tetracyclines, ampicillin, etc. Deconjugation of estrogens excreted in bile fails to occur → their enterohepatic circulation is interrupted → blood levels fall. Treatment - Switch over to a preparation containing 50 µg of ethinylestradiol Use an alternative method of contraception. Rifampin is usually taken for a long time and is such a potent enzyme inducer that alternative contraception should be advised.
